intro: Plicouratea conegi, commonly known as the Conegi's plicourate, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a leathery texture and dark green color. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and emit a subtle fragrance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Plicouratea conegi is considered a vulnerable species in its natural range.
